TextAsset.value: (Gosh, it sure is crowded in here.)
(Not sure why Max wants to discuss secret plan stuff where anyone could overhear it though!)
${slot:playerName}! Over here. I saved you a spot in line.
(He’s at the end of the line…)
(Well, it’s the thought that counts.)
Thanks, Max.
So.
We shall count this as a top secret meeting of the Military History Club.
Strictly closed doors. Need to know basis. Beyond top secret.
About that. Are you sure it’s safe? I mean, can’t anyone overhear us?
That’s the beauty of it! There’s so many kids in here all talking at once that our conversation will be indecipherable from background noise!
I can hear everything you’re saying.
Quite clearly.
Okay, but that’s not important though!
We’ll be using big time military jargon and top secret codenames and stuff.
So, even if you could hear us, it won’t matter because it’ll sound like jibberish!
You’re gonna talk about your secret plans for the super plane you’re building.
Okay, but that’s not important either though!
Because no one talks to Tomari.
Thankfully.
Also I consulted him on the design spec parameters, so he knew all about it anyway.
It’s true.
The opportunity to contemplate a challenging project was all the payment that was required.
But the cookies were a nice touch, Max.
Of course!
There’s more in the pipeline, by the way. We’re still in committee on the topic, but there’s been some headway recently.
Very good.
Keep me informed.
So, you see, ${slot:playerName}? Perfectly secure!
I guess it kind of is.
Okay, so. Let us discuss PROJECT SUPER SECRET PLANE.
Roger.
Ha! Very good.
Remember now, PROJECT SUPER SECRET PLANE is just the codename for SECRET PROJECT SUPER PLANE.
Don’t confuse them for two separate ops.
Right.
Oh, and ops is a codename for operations.
It’s very military.
Hm, yeah. I think I got it.
It’s a plane of my own design.
Mostly your design.
With some outside consultancy, yes.
Anyway!
I don’t have time to design it up and to build it and go to school and run the Military History Club and sleep and eat.
So, I’ve been working on PROJECT SUPER SECRET PLANE on my homework and test sheets and quizzes and stuff.
Aren’t you afraid that’ll give away the secret?
I like how you think, ${slot:playerName}. Very security oriented. That’s good.
I make sure to break up different parts of the designs into different assignments from different classes!
That way, no single teacher has access to anything more than a fraction of a part of any system. It’ll just look like doodles and random goof off stuff to them!
That’s good thinking.
I know!
But it gets better. The designs are all done.
You’re welcome, by the way.
Thanks to some outside consultancy, yes.
ANYWAY!
We can build the plane and get extra school spirit credit for the Military History Club to reduce our detention.
And then at the same time it’ll keep us bully free because we’ll fly from one class to the next! Pretty great, huh?
I have to admit, it is!
But is it really fair to let me piggyback on this thing? It seems like you already did all the work.
It would be more precise to say all the work was done.
Yes. Thank you, Tomari. Your contributions will go down in history.
Top secret history, that is!
Actually, won’t it it be completely NOT AT ALL secret when we’re seen flying everywhere?
Ah. Uh, well…
And, come to think of it, what do you want with a plane anyway?
You’re a bird, aren’t you?
Uh, y-yeah. Flying.
Like a bird. Like normal. Heh.
MEETING ADJOURNED THOUGH!
(What the heck was that all about?)
Okay but now we need to call an emergency session of the Military History Club.
But you just ended the meeting?
This is to discuss new business about something else entirely.
Namely: the part where we need to get all those designs I turned in for homework and tests and stuff!
What do you mean?
As we discussed in the previous meeting…
...Actually, this is where having the minutes of the previous meeting would come in really handy.
I’ll see to it that we commission a report on a survey for a committee to explore the possibility of formalizing our record keeping procedures for secret and emergency meetings.
But until then we’ll have to rely on memory!
So, last time we were here we spoke about the designs. Remember?
(Of course I remember! It was like ten seconds ago!)
Yes. But only vaguely.
For security purposes.
Excellent. Well, the designs are done, as I said, but they’ve all been turned in to different teachers!
And that means you don’t have some of them?
Correct.
Or, more to the point...any of them!
Oh, no.
Oh, yup!
Therefore, construction has been, um, delayed.
Can we wait for the teachers to give back your homework?
We don’t have that kind of time. It could take them days. Or weeks!
OR YEARS!
Probably not years.
No, probably not.
But we can’t take the chance!
We need to implement a pre-emptive strike!
Mission.
Parameter.
Yeah!
Who’s with me?
(Who’s he asking? Aren’t I the only one here?)
Um. Well, I’ll help out. Sure.
You’ve got the backing of the entire Military History Club cabinet.
And its senior members.
And its parliament.
And its house of commons.
And its caliphate.
And its--
Max.
${slot:playerName}?
All of those are just you, right? You staff all of those positions.
Most of them. For some I’m only acting in Aki’s stead.
And there is an occasional need for outside consultancy in any sufficiently complex system.
Does that mean we’ve got Tomari’s support too?
Conflict of interest, I’m afraid.
He’s a nerd for hire.
I prefer the term knowledge mercenary.
Regardless. Tomari is like the wind.
Looks like it’s up to you and me, ${slot:playerName}!
I’m sure we can do it!
Yeah!
We’ll set up a report to survey a commission to staff an exploratory committee to--
If it isn’t Blue Dork!
AHH!
(Sheesh! Does everyone come here?!?)
And his friend Cute New Dork.
Haw haw!
(Ugh, why does he think hitting on me WHILE he’s bullying me will work?!)
We don’t want any trouble, Taira.
Yo, that’s too bad. ‘Cause I want trouble!
Thought you wanted revenge, Captain.
Revenge IS trouble.
FOR THEM!
C’mon, Taira. This is the cafe. It’s hallowed ground.
They’re bullies.
Nothing is sacred to them!
He’s right!
Except, I guess, the revenge.
But that’s more a function of your backstory though. Like, us? We’re pretty much so-so on the revenge angle.
Okay, yeah. That’s a good point.
No prob, Captain.
Why do you need to get revenge on poor Max anyway?
‘Cause we got in trouble earlier!
How is that Max’s fault?!
What we got in trouble for was pushing him around some!
That’s not Max’s fault!
YOU guys chose to cause trouble.
Yeah, but we wouldn’t if he wasn’t so mad revenge-able!
HIS FAULT!
Forget it, ${slot:playerName}!
Logic won’t work on bullies.
He’s right!
Well, you can’t start a fight in the cafe.
It’s against the rules!
Oh no!
(Did...did that really work?!?)
Hey!
I think they're trickin’ us with their brain games!
(Dangit.)
Guys, crowdsource the answer to that one.
I’ll get some kinda other temporary revenge until we can come back and do one up proper. Revenge is mad complicated. You’re too dumb to understand.
(Well, it kind of worked?)
(Poor Max is shaking like a leaf!)
(Why can’t these guys just leave him alone?)
Step aside, Shrimp.
You’re gettin’...
SKIPPED IN LINE!
That’s definitely against the rules too though!
Yeah. But it’s a lesser offense!
Probably?
Yo, I don’t have time for egghead brain debate theater. It’s already half past revenge!
No.
It’s not fair. Not to Max, or me, or anyone behind us!
(Okay, yeah, we’re still at the back of the line, but it’s the principle of the thing!)
Look, New Dork. This is happening.
Just roll over.
(Little does he know that I do the rolling around here!!!)
(...Uh. But not without my katamari ball of course.)
(Hm. Don’t have much of a rejoinder for that taunt after all, I guess!)
C’mon. Move it.
YOU SHALL NOT PASS!
No, ${slot:playerName}! It’s not worth it!
ROOOOAAAAR!
Oh, no!
Is this…
SKIPPING?!?
Only not in the delinquent sense of ditching class, but rather skipping people IN LINE?
YOU’RE ALREADY AT THE END OF THE LINE!!!
You kids need to show more ambition if you’re going to go through the trouble of causing trouble!
The only question now is which one of you to punish...
It was Taira and his gang trying to push around Blue Max again!
A likely story, ${slot:playerName}.
In fact, it’s one I’ve heard a dozen times.
Probably because of all the times Taira and his gang pushed around Blue Max.
ROOOOAAR ROAR!!!
Yes, I know, it’s already half past wrestling.
Look, we don’t have much time. So, instead I’m meting out the best kind of justice.
ALL OF YOU VERSUS KING IN TAGTEAM CAGEMATCH WRESTLING!
AAAHHH!!!
Aw, man.
But I can’t do that without a signed permission slip from your parents and for some reason none of the parents in Namco Land want me to let their kids get demolished in the ring.
Go figure.
So, instead of that, we’ll do the second best kind of justice.
INDISCRIMINATE!!!
Ahh?
Aww?
Therefore, everyone involved with this altercation is hereby sentenced to…
DETENTION LEVEL EIGHT -- DARK REALM DETENTION!!!
(That...can’t be real. Can it?!)
Where you will be cursed to fight the undead for a thousand years!
(HOW IS THAT LEGAL???)
Only a thousand? Haw, sounds like a vacation, yo.
You just got yourself Double Dark Realm Detention, mister.
What?! So uncool!
I’ll get you for this, Blue Dork!
I’ll get yoooooooooooooooouuuuuuuuu…
(OH MY GOSH!!!)
(Is he being banished to the Dark Realm before my very eyes?!?!?!)
...uuuuuuu...
*cough ahem cough*
Sorry. My voice just does that sometimes. It’s weird.
Off to the Double Dark Realm with you and your lackeys.
It’ll be in room 302.
Yeah, yeah. I know where it is.
As for the rest of you, straighten up and fly right.
Fly?! Why are you making us fly?
You can’t do that! Your authority only goes so far!
Gravity happens y’know and maybe that’s to keep us safely on the ground you ever think about that?
(Whoa, where’s all this coming from?)
I was speaking poetically, Blue Max.
I paint pictures with the brush of language. As all principals do.
Oh. Y-yeah, I knew that.
Now, get back to school grounds. Don’t make me do more justice on you.
We won’t, sir!
Max, are you okay?
(Gosh, he’s still shaking a little!)
Y-yeah. I’ll be fine.
I am fine, I mean.
I’m fine!
Let’s just never talk about this ever again.
If you say so…
(We didn’t talk about it, but I kept thinking about it all through the rest of the day.)
(Especially, though, I thought about how much Max freaked out every time someone mentioned flying…)
